title: EIP-2537: Precompile for BLS12-381 curve operations
description: Adds precompiled contracts for BLS12-381 curve operations to enable efficient cryptographic operations.
author: Alex Vlasov, et al.
laymanDescription: A new precompile for the BLS12-381 curve, a native function built in clients that smart contracts can use to verify signatures and perform certain operation more cheaply and securely.

scaleL1.description: More efficient perations for cryptography-heavy apps and enable more complex protocols at L1 capacity.

improveUX.description: Lower fees and better security users relying on apps using BLS signatures.

endUsers.description: Lower gas and better security for apps that use BLS signatures (e.g., staking, bridges).

appDevs.description: Can rely on a standard, efficient precompile for BLS operations instead of custom Solidity code.

toolingInfra.description: Indexers and tools that analyze execution on EVM level will need to update to recognize the new precompile.

layer2s.description: EVM L2s need to update to stay compatible, certain L1 operations can take advantage of this.

stakersNodes.description: Not a direct impact on regular validators. Some pools with onchain infrastracture can upgrade to utilize the precompile.

clClients.description: Beacon Chain unchanged; this is an execution-layer precompile.

elClients.description: Implementation, testing and fuzzing the new precompile for performance and correctness.

benefits: Cheaper and safer BLS signature verification
Enables efficient cryptography for certain use cases like staking, light clients, bridges and ZK
Easier for devs, more secure and cheaper for users
